contacts.name: Karina Isabel Sanz S.
contacts.title: Directora de Gestión de Riesgos y Desastres

field_reports.description:
The Venezuelan government has implemented various measures to deal with the rains of June 2025, which have affected several regions of the country. Inspections have been carried out in ravines and vulnerable areas, as part of the 2025 Rainfall Plan, with the aim of preventing overflows and guaranteeing the safety of communities. To attend to emergencies due to rains in Mérida, Táchira, Trujillo and Barinas. The National Armed Forces and regional and local authorities have been deployed to the "Andes 2025" Plan. On the other hand,the National Institute of Meteorology and Hydrology (INAMEH) has issued alerts about intense rainfall and electrical discharges in multiple states, including Bolívar, Amazonas, Apure, Lara and Zulia. In addition, Civil Protection teams have been deployed in Táchira to monitor the effects and coordinate responses to emergencies.

The governor of the state of Mérida, Arnaldo Sánchez, reported that 12 municipalities have been affected by the intense rains recorded in the last few hours. Among the most impacted areas are Pueblo Llano, Cardenal Quintero, Rangel, Miranda, Santo Marquino, Libertador and Campo Elías. For its part, Civil Protection of the state of Mérida announced on its social networks the activation of an Emergency Plan in the Páramo.

contacts.name: Karina Isabel Sanz S.
contacts.title: Directora de Gestión de Riesgo y Desastres

field_reports.description: Since May 2025, Venezuela has faced episodes of intense and prolonged rainfall due to the passage of various tropical waves, including numbers 5 and 6. These weather conditions caused severe floods, river floods and landslides, especially affecting some localities in the states of Zulia, Táchira, Amazonas, Apure, Bolívar, Monagas, Sucre, Mérida, Barinas and Trujillo. The National Institute of Meteorology and Hydrology (INAMEH) warned about the presence of convective systems with electrical activity and rains of different intensity in much of the national territory. Likewise, the institute projected the continuation of intense rainfall in regions such as the Andes, Western Plains, Guyana and coastal areas, warning of the possible arrival of new tropical waves in the coming days. A situation which has kept Civil Protection and regional authorities on alert.

results.summary: Since May 2025, Venezuela has faced episodes of intense and prolonged rainfall due to the passage of various tropical waves, including numbers 5 and 6. These weather conditions caused severe floods, river floods and landslides, especially affecting some localities in the states of Zulia, Táchira, Amazonas, Apure, Bolívar, Monagas, Sucre, Mérida, Barinas and Trujillo. The National Institute of Meteorology and Hydrology (INAMEH) warned about the presence of convective systems with electrical activity and rains of different intensity in much of the national territory. Likewise, the institute projected the continuation of intense rainfall in regions such as the Andes, Western Plains, Guyana and coastal areas, warning of the possible arrival of new tropical waves in the coming days. A situation which has kept Civil Protection and regional authorities on alert.
results.name: VEN: Pluvial flood / flood - 06-2025 - Floods June 2025

field_reports.summary: VEN: Pluvial flood / flood - 06-2024 - Floods Venezuela 2024
field_reports.description:
The passage of Tropical Wave 15 (Hurricane Beryl), has left strong effects in several sectors of the state of Sucre, the information was released by the governor of the eastern entity, Gilberto Pinto, through a contact through the network of state broadcasters, in which he assured that officials of the citizen protection agencies and institutions of public services and infrastructure are attending to the situation.

The regional president explained that among the affected communities are Barrio Blanco, La Fragua, Las Tinajitas, Avenida Antonio José de Sucre, Las Morritas and Las Trincheras. All these adjacent areas are under water. The river is crossing the city of Cumanacoa and we have as a focus and source of attention the community of La Fragua, which is at a low level and may merit an evacuation. Air resources have been requested to prepare for this action but the weather conditions are not favorable.

On the other hand, Las Tinajitas, Trincheras, Los Cedros and Palenque, were part of the communities that have been greatly affected. He said that the "José Luis Ramos" school in Cumanacoa was enabled to serve the victims, children and pregnant women. The governor announced the closure of access to the area from Monagas and Cumaná.

In contact with Globovisión, the regional president said that measures have already been taken to address the contingencies generated by the rains. He said that Civil Protection officials, firefighters, VEN 911, among others, are in the area, and said that the rains until 9:00 am continue at the head of the river, so its flow is still high.

He specified that the passage is interrupted from Puerto Madera and said that air support has been requested to evacuate people, but that solution is not yet possible due to weather conditions.

results.name: VEN: Pluvial flood / flood - 06-2024 - Floods Venezuela 2024

results.summary:
However, the

state of Sucre has taken care of the community of Montalbán, which is located in a mountainous area, surrounded by 3 rivers (Rio Manzanares, Rio Caribe and Rio Guaduas), these being the main source of water collection of the community. and which is transported by pipes to the houses; Based on the above, this mechanism does not go through purification processes; As a result of the recent rains, an analysis process of the vital liquid has been carried out, which has yielded a turbidity result of 20 NTU. For this reason, the branch of this town has started with the deliveries of jerry cans and water purification tablets to several families in the community. Similarly, the proliferation of flies and mosquitoes in the sector has been perceived, as well as the increase in diarrheal and respiratory diseases.

On the other hand, the heavy rains caused the flooding of the Valle Verde ravine and consequently the landslide of Cerro Pan de Azúcar, leaving 119 families affected out of the 245 that live in this community, this has been one of the most affected localities since the atmospheric rainfall originated in 2022. After the arrival of the rainy season this year, the situation has intensified, motivated by new landslides and the constant flooding of the ravine.

In another sense, the Aragua state section has carried out the evaluation of some sectors of the state which have been most affected by these atmospheric events, among which the community of La Punta stands out, where the agglomeration of stagnant water prevails due to the lack of drainage systems that facilitate the circulation of these. causing the proliferation of diarrheal diseases and the appearance of abundant mosquitoes in the sector. Although the branch has been carrying out early action plans and training in the areas of Health and Water, Sanitation and Hygiene, after the event a total of 20 affected families in the locality are managed.

Another of the communities that are once again affected in this state is Las Tejerias, which after the tragedy that occurred during 2022 is still in reconstruction plans; It is important to note that this community continues to have help from government entities and NGOs, as well as the actions implemented by the National Society in the Health and Water sectors. Sanitation and Hygiene, including the installation of a water treatment plant that provides access to safe water to the people who reside in the different sectors that make it up. However, despite the work carried out by the Red Cross WASH team, even today the basic water service is scarce and unsafe in some other sectors of the municipality.
results.name: COME : Flood - 10-2023 - Flood Field Update 2023

field_reports.description:
The year 2022 has been an atypical year in relation to the start of the rainy season in Venezuela. Since 20 April, rainfall has increased by approximately 100% above the historical rainfall for the month in the national territory, due to the onset of the La Niña phenomenon and other hydro-meteorological alterations. 
These rains have caused flooding in urban and rural areas, affecting homes, small businesses, plantations and crops, public infrastructure, hospitals and roads due to landslides in the states of Mérida, Zulia, Trujillo, Táchira, Distrito Capital, Carabobo, Lara, Portuguesa and Yaracuy. 
According to the Official Gazette published on 27 April and posted on the official website of the Servicio Autónomo Imprenta Nacional y Gaceta Oficial, under No. 42. 364, in Article 1: A State of Emergency is declared in the states of Mérida, Zulia, Trujillo, Táchira, Municipio Bolivariano Libertador del Distrito Capital, and Gran Caracas; as a consequence of the intense and recurrent rains that have occurred in said territories, for a period of ninety (90) days counted from the publication of this Decree in the Official Gazette of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, in the affected areas, the period indicated in this article may be extended for the same period, by Decree.

contacts.name: Marissa Soberanis
contacts.title: Coordinadora de Programas y Operaciones Delegación Venezuela FICR

field_reports.description:
Las lluvias registradas la noche del lunes 23 de agosto causaron afectaciones en varios estados del territorio nacional.
A través del INAMEH (Instituto Nacional de Metereología e Hidrología) del país: Para la fecha de creación de este reporte se aprecian áreas nubladas productoras de lluvias en casi la totalidad del territorio nacional, los más destacados serán Zulia, Guarico, Anzoategui, Amazonas y Bolivar; apreciandose en el resto del país nubosidad fragmentada y algunas otras lluvias o lloviznas dispersas..

contacts.name: Marissa Soberanis
contacts.title: Coordinadora de Programas y Operaciones Delegación Venezuela FICR

field_reports.description:
Las lluvias registradas la noche del lunes 23 de agosto causaron afectaciones en estados como Yaracuy, Apure Miranda, Vargas, Bolívar, Carabobo y Mérida. En este último estado, las precipitaciones en los municipios Tovar, Antonio Pinto Salinas y Santos Marquina.
A través del INAMEH (Instituto Nacional de Metereología e Hidrología) del país: Se aprecian áreas nubladas productoras de lluvias en zonas del Zulia, Táchira, Falcón, Apure, Barinas, Carabobo, Yaracuy, Cojedes, Miranda, Delta Amacuro, Amazonas, Bolívar y el Esequibo; el resto del país con nubosidad de parcial a fragmentada.
